title: OMB CDC Correspondence regarding measuremente and data collection

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all correspondence between OMB and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention regarding measurement and indicators of race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, and/or disability status from January 1, 2020 through present. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Jessica Elm

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: ALPR audit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Concerning Flock Safety, these files;

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of January 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

Typically the output for these audits is available in monthly batches.

3. A list of network share settings that include:
3a. Flock networks shared with me
3b. Networks that I’m sharing

Please provide records in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Traci Phelps

title: FOIA Request for Information Concerning Houston and Flock Safety (Houston Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information pertaining to the Houston and the Houston Police Department's (HPD) relationship with the company Flock Safety and the use of Flock cameras by Houston and HPD.

Flock Audit Logs:
- Organization Audit logs, including all searches conducted by HPD personnel.
The report should include data logged from the period of February 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

- Network Audit logs, including searches of HPD’s Flock network by any external agency.
The report should include data logged from the period of February 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

- Search Audit logs, including: User conducting the search, date, and time of search.
- Search reason or justification for each search conducted.

Data Sharing Between HPD and Other Agencies:
- Records reflecting Flock data sharing between HPD and other police departments (PDs), cities, agencies, and organizations.
- Records reflecting any Flock data sharing between HPD and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) or other federal agencies.
- Records reflecting any Flock data sharing between Alvin Independent School District (Alvin ISD) and ICE, to the extent such records are maintained by HPD.
- Records indicating whether HPD has shared Flock data or related information with ICE or other federal agencies.
- Identification of all external organizations with access to HPD’s Flock system data.

Federal and Interagency Searches:
- Records of any requests from federal agencies, other police departments, or external agencies to search a license plate number or for a particular person using information from Flock.
- Records of searches conducted by external agencies within HPD’s Flock network.

Hotlist Data:
- The number of vehicle searches performed by HPD and any participating departments based on hotlist hits.
- The number of hotlist hits.
- The hotlist hit rate.

The number of times Flock’s hotlist generated a hit based on:
- A citation for driving without a license, or
- An ICE administrative warrant.

Policies and Guidelines:
- Internal HPD policy guidelines concerning Flock data sharing.

Internal HPD policies regarding data sharing with:
- Other police departments
- Government agencies
- School districts
- Private businesses
- Homeowners associations (HOAs)
- Any other external organizations

The report(s) and records should include data logged from February 1, 2025, to the date this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Concerned

title: Bad Bunny Super Bowl FCC Complaints

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Bad Bunny Super Bowl FCC Complaints
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To the FOIA Officer:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the FCC's implementing regulations, 47 C.F.R. § 0.461.

I request that the Federal Communications Commission provide me with copies of the following records:

All formal and informal complaints submitted to the FCC regarding the Super Bowl LIX halftime show performance by the artist Bad Bunny (Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio), which was broadcast on February 8, 2026.

All correspondence, including letters and emails, from members of the U.S. Congress, their staffs, or other government officials concerning this specific performance.

Any records, including but not limited to docket filings or public comments, filed in response to or citing the investigations requested by Congressman Randy Fine (as referenced in public reports from February 2026) or other officials .

The timeframe for this request is February 8, 2026, through the date of this request's processing.

I am willing to pay reasonable duplication fees for this request up to $25 Please notify me before exceeding this amount. As a requester seeking information that is likely in the public interest, I ask that you waive any fees associated with this request, as the disclosure of the requested information is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of FCC enforcement and broadcast decency standards.

If you deny all or any part of this request, please cite each specific exemption you believe justifies the withholding of information and notify me of your appeal procedures.

If you have any questions regarding this request, or if you require any additional information to facilitate processing, please contact me at the phone number or email address listed above.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Carlos

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All resisting and obstructing (R&O) incident reports and related materials involving officer Zachary Bennett.

For each R&O‑related incident involving the above officers, please provide:
All incidents reports including
Officer narratives 
Officer names
Date, time, and location
All charges
All related documents
Any internal summaries or case notes associated with the incident
Body-worn camera footage
All body‑worn camera footage recorded by the listed officers
All body‑worn camera footage recorded by any other officer present
Any audio recordings associated with the incident
Dispatch Records
911 call audio (if applicable)
Dispatch notes or timestamps

The time frame for all requests is January 1, 2023 to December 31, 2025.

I am requesting these records in my capacity as a journalist investigating matters of significant public interest regarding Resisting and Obstructing charges in Kalamazoo County. The requested documents will contribute to public understanding of the charge and the way they are issued.
For records originating or only existing in digital form, I respectfully request these records be provided in their native electronic formats that preserve all metadata. Specifically:
Body‑cam and footage: original video files
Emails: .eml or .msg
Documents: .docx, .xlsx, .pdf (searchable)

Please deliver these electronic records to the email address listed below. If file size limitations prevent email delivery, I am willing to accept records via a secure file transfer method of your choosing or provide a storage device, if necessary.

If the documents I have requested are not disclosable in their entirety, I request that you release all nonexempt portions of the documents after separating them from the portions you deem exempt. With respect to documents or portions of documents that are exempt, please state with particularity the specific legal and factual basis justifying each exemption, as well as the nature of information being withheld. See MCL 15.235(5)(a)-(c); MCL 15.244. This includes identifying those records that are being withheld in their entirety. See Herald Co, Inc v Ann Arbor Public Schools, 224 Mich App 266, 275 (1997).

If no responsive documents exist for a particular portion of this request, please clearly identify which portions of this request have been denied for that reason, rather than providing a general statement of non-existence.
If you determine that any portion of my request is exempt because it contains information you deem privileged or deliberative, please identify the specific privileged information with particularity and provide the factual basis for the deliberative process claim.

Pursuant to MCL 15.234(2), I request a waiver or reduction of fees as this request is made by a representative of the news media and the requested information is in the public interest because it contributes significantly to the public's understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester. If you do not grant this fee waiver, please contact me before processing if the total cost will exceed $500.00.

Please note that willful failure to comply with a FOIA request is grounds for civil fines, and legal fees and costs may be awarded to a plaintiff who prevails in a FOIA case, especially where the public body has acted arbitrarily and capriciously in denying the FOIA request. See MCL 15.240(6).

I appreciate your assistance in processing this request in a timely manner as required by law. If you need any clarification or have any questions about this request, please contact me immediately at coriosterman@nowkalamazoo.org.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cori Osterman

title: Transgender Healthcare for ICE Detainees in Contracted Jail Facilities (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Transgender Healthcare for ICE Detainees in Contracted Jail Facilities (Immigration and Customs Enforcement)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the period of January 1, 2023, through the date this request is processed, I request records concerning the provision of medical and mental health care to transgender individuals detained in facilities operated by, or under contract with, U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE).

Specifically, I request:

Policies, procedures, directives, training materials, or guidance regarding gender-affirming medical or mental health care, including hormone therapy continuation or initiation, housing and classification decisions and medical accommodations for transgender detainees.

Communications (including emails, memoranda, letters, meeting notes) between ICE, the Department of Homeland Security, ICE contractors, state agencies or local government entities regarding:

The provision or limitation of gender-affirming care for transgender detainees;

Compliance with state laws restricting public funding or provision of transgender-related medical treatment, including but not limited to Kansas Senate Bill 63 (“Help Not Harm Act”).

Contracts, intergovernmental service agreements (IGSAs), statements of work, task orders or amendments between ICE and any state, county or private detention facility addressing medical care responsibilities, standards of care or exclusions applicable to transgender detainees.

Grievances, complaints, incident reports, investigations or internal reviews relating to alleged denial, delay, modification or termination of gender-affirming medical care for transgender ICE detainees.

Billing records, invoices, reimbursements or denials reflecting whether gender-affirming medical services were approved, denied or excluded from payment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JasmineLewin

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the period of January 1, 2023, until whenever this request is fulfilled, I request access to and copies of the following records concerning the provision of medical and mental health care to transgender individuals housed in your facility under contracts or agreements with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Communications (including emails, letters, meeting notes) between your agency and ICE or ICE contractors, the Kansas Department of Health and Environment, or any county/state officials regarding compliance with Kansas Senate Bill 63 (“Help Not Harm Act”) or any limits on government funding or provision of transgender-related medical treatment.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

title: Obama Presidential Library: Convergence of Mifsud, Epstein, Andreyev and Timoshenkova at SPIEF 2015

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Obama Presidential Library: Convergence of Mifsud, Epstein, Andreyev and Timoshenkova at SPIEF 2015
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records regarding the intersection of specific individuals and entities at the St. Petersburg International Economic Forum (SPIEF) in June 2015. 

I. Records Requested

I request all records, including cables, meeting logs, attendee rosters, security manifests, photographic evidence, open-source video collection or dissemination or internal briefing summaries, that discuss or list the following individuals as participants, attendees, or delegates at SPIEF 2015:

Joseph Mifsud (linked to the Russian International Affairs Council).

Jeffrey Epstein (specifically seeking verification of his travel to St. Petersburg during the forum window).

Anton Andreyev (representing Vdolg.ru or the Roscongress Foundation).

Daria Timoshenkova (aka Daria Aslanova, representing Vdolg.ru or Roscongress).

II. Specific Inquiry

I am seeking to determine if these four individuals were present at the same forum events, specifically within the "Young Leaders Forum," the "Fintech/IT Innovation" pavilions, or the plenary sessions organized by the Roscongress Foundation.

III. Keyword Search Parameters

To facilitate a comprehensive search of electronic records, cables, photo archives and internal databases, I request that the following keywords be used:

Entities: "Vdolg.ru", "Vdolg", "Вдолг", "Roscongress", "SPIEF 2015", "Young Leaders Forum", "P2P lending Russia".

Individuals (Phonetic/Aliases): "Mifsud", "Jeffrey Epstein", "Andreyev, Anton", "Andreev, Anton", "Timoshenkova, Darya", "Timoshenkova, Daria", "Aslanova, Daria", "Aslanova, Darya", "Дарья Асланова."

Technical/Operational: "INN 7714808861", "Project Lakhta", "Information Operations St. Petersburg", "Identity Harvesting", "Digital Sovereignty Forum".

III. Targeted Offices

Please search the records of the National Security Council (NSC), the Office of the National Security Advisor, and any "Spot Reports" or cables shared by the U.S. Embassy in Moscow (specifically the Political-Economic and Regional Security sections).

Note: Of special interest is the possible convergence of Epstein, Mifsud, Andreyev and Timoshenkova in one event. 

Andreyev and Timoshenkova were pioneers in Russian FinTech and used their expertise to create the financial infrastructure that assisted the Kremlin's 2016 election interference efforts. The Epstein files includes several documents which detail Epstein's interest in attending the networking event and hobnobbing with young Russians in the financial sector. Here is an example: https://www.justice.gov/epstein/files/DataSet%209/EFTA01191262.pdf

Plain language: If Epstein was at this event, documentation of it by the U.S. government would have likely been generated. 

Thank you to the Obama Presidential Library and for the library's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Leila Shahid
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Palestinian diplomat Leila Shahid (13 July 1949 – 18 February 2026). Her name is spelled ليلى شهيد in Arabic. Her death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find her France24 obituary at the following link: https://www.france24.com/en/video/20260219-leila-shahid-first-female-palestinian-ambassador-dies-in-france-at-76

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an associate editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest for the Daily Beast, the Asia Times, Responsible Statecraft, the National Interest, America Magazine and the Armenian Weekly, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

**

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.
